other_tests.findings: Atrial fibrillation, 115 b.p.m., incomplete right bundle branch block, and non-specific repolarization abnormalities.

Severe dilatation of the right ventricle at end diastole (56 mm) and right atrium at end systole (74 mm, area of 43 cm2), paradoxical ventricular septal motion, severe TR (vena contracta = 11 mm), TAPSE was 16 mm, normal left ventricular ejection fraction (65%).
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 3-month follow-up, the transthoracic echocardiogram showed a normal functioning prosthesis, absence of peri-prosthetic regurgitation, and transvalvular gradients similar to those measured immediately post-surgery. A partial recovery of RV function was observed, with a calculated TAPSE of 12 mm.

other_tests.findings: Total absence of the posterior tricuspid leaflet, slightly hypoplastic anterior leaflet, normal septal leaflet.
Confirmed findings of total absence of the posterior tricuspid leaflet.
Normal pulmonary arterial pressure of 26/6 mmHg and a Qp/Qs ratio of 1.
Normally functioning prosthesis with normal transvalvular gradients (maximum/medium = 7/4 mmHg), mild (Grade I) TR present, RV function moderately impaired (TAPSE = 7â€“8 mm).
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 3-month follow-up, RV function showed partial recovery (TAPSE = 12 mm, fractional area change of 35%).
